basics.name: Kevin Faulkner
basics.label: Computer Systems Engineer
basics.summary: I am a dedicated devops engineer who utilizes combined experiences from my military and technology background to lead, innovate, learn, and teach others.

work.summary: Remotely supporting the Zelle bank to bank payment system in AWS
highlights: Sustaining an environment that is almost entirely infrastructure as code with changes done through Terraform and controlled by git
Multiple spring boot applications all in a secure environment with TLS everywhere (often two-way)
Team expert on containerization tech, rewriting builds and deployment methods
Wrote Python and Go scripts used in production

work.summary: 35k requests per minute Python and Node production applications in AWS
highlights: Worked on the “devops” team to automate new applications and deploy them to AWS
Worked closely with application developers to troubleshoot issues with the platform, automate and deploy new applications
Responded to client/customer issues without hesitating to dive into a packet capture to diagnose any issues
Supported Ubuntu and CentOS varying from rails applications, NodeJS and Django (uwsgi) applications

work.summary: Lean team heavily utilizing open source tech to maximize efficiency
highlights: embraced devops methods when working with AWS, VMWare and physical machines
Wrote scripts to help integrate these systems with the workflow mostly in git
maintained, expanded and upgraded Hadoop systems
Majority of the applications were Tomcat Java apps with MySQL as the primary database

work.summary: Sole Linux engineer for Global education network (Mexico, UK, Chile, US)
highlights: Solely responsible for 500+ VMware ESXi and physical Linux/UNIX machines, and many NFS shares mounted from the Netapp (mode 7)
Created builds from the development teams requirements for applications or Oracle database
Worked with development teams to identify bottlenecks and issues in systems and web applications and implemented solutions to identified problems
Evaluated and implemented a monitoring solutions
Developed scripts and automation tools for new images, began to bootstrap devops program

work.summary: part of a movement to support production applications and work with developers (site reliability roots)
highlights: Production applications most JBOSS 4 & 5, but ranging from Orion, Tomcat, Glassfish, and Resin also including ASP.net applications
Worked across the three tier architecture to fully troubleshoot undocumented work
Utilized system tools such as sysstat and strace when systems breached their thresholds
Deployed tools such as Cacti and New Relic (only available on Java at the time) to gather performance details and form conclusions as to the nature that lead to SLA
On call with escalations requiring a fulfillment time of under fifteen minutes

work.summary: secure transmission of DICOM images to radiologists around the world using Linux machines
highlights: Worked with hospitals to troubleshoot VPN’s and Diagnostic imaging machines communicating with the DICOM/HL7 protocols
Supported all systems that sent and most that received images were Linux
Managed Linux systems to transfer images through hospitals with Cisco VPN’s (on ASA 5520)
Leadership
character growth

work.summary: Credit Card processing company where we focused on security, departed early due to Army Activation
highlights: Performed tape backups to be taken off site as part of a disaster recovery plan
Participated in PCI audits
Built physical and virtual servers with scripts and CFEngine
Ran nmap scans and nessus and acted on vulnerable items
Assisted in administering 1500 node Linux based Charter school
Maintained self hosted from PHP moodle web applications, BIND DNS, to asterisk PBX phone systems
Managed Postfix and dovecot as the primary mail server
Utilized Linux to drive costs down within the organization
Leadership
character growth

awards.title: Expert Infantrymans Badge
awards.summary: Physical fitness and weapons competency test: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Expert_Infantryman_Badge

publications.name: Blog
publications.summary: Self published blog with various experiences and notes

interests.name: Linux
keywords: Fedora based Home router and Access Point (hostapd,BIND,ISC DHCP,squid,firewalld)
